result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Cartwright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay statutory costs, to include $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by DOC

--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A Cartwright

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL: Letter from Bkpg to Defendant regarding Lost/Uncashed Check.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights w/elements and CCS form

Case called at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Cartwright in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Atty. Lippert indicates that the firearm used in this crime is 'forever lost'

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year.

The Court adopts all the conditions as set forth is the Criminal Case Settlement

[which are:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay statutory costs, to include $100 domestic abuse surcharge]

The Court orders Mr. Cartwright to provide a DNA sample to JESO today
The Court denies Mr. Cartwright the opportunity for expungement 

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 9:13am
to Defendant (No Surety listed on Bond) - per 2/8/16 court order.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:06am. 
Defendant Joshua A Cartwright in court.   ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Plea of "not guilty" entered
The Court extends the time limit for ten days for the Defendant's rights to substitution and to request speedy trial;  if a demand for speedy trial is not raised within ten days, then speedy trial rights are waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 Cash Bond ($350 cash was posted;  the clerk is to return $200 of this amount to the surety), with added conditions: 
--no discusssion of the case with Holly Jones
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of firearms
recess 11:14am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/16 at 10:40am   (2)  Status Conference on 4/26/16 at 8:30am
